As I mentioned earlier, now our company has to correct our marketing with a disclaimer stating that the course has a course attached. You should know, that I’ve taken the steps to correct 20 points accross the internet that the marketing may have been unclear. 8 mentions on YouTube. 7 mentions on the currently available shopify products, and 5 on our website and blog. We’ve replaced all existing hyperlinks with new ones for people to subscribe to our YouTube channel. Moving forward we’ll be more cognizant and take actions to prevent this from happening again.

With this knowledge, can you please, write a response to this section of a letter: "Per NAB procedures, Harmony Healthcare International, Inc. has thirty (30) days to correct the above issue and must contact NAB, in writing, to provide information on what has been done to remediate this concern. If not resolved, further action will be taken, which could include suspension and/or revocation or your NAB sponsor status.”

"We at Harmony Healthcare International, Inc. acknowledge the concern raised by NAB regarding the lack of clarity in our marketing efforts for our 8 week Requirements of Participation (ROP) Free-Key Friday Webinar Series. We apologize for any confusion caused and want to assure NAB that we have taken immediate steps to correct the issue. We have corrected 20 points across the internet, including 8 mentions on YouTube, 7 mentions on our currently available Shopify products, and 5 on our website and blog. Additionally, we have replaced all existing hyperlinks with new ones directing viewers to our YouTube channel.

We understand the importance of clear and accurate marketing and want to assure NAB that we will be more cognizant in the future and take necessary actions to prevent similar issues from arising again. We have also made sure that all materials now contain the disclaimer that obtaining Continuing Education (CE) Credits and a certificate for each course requires registration and a fee of $59.99 on shop.harmony-healthcare.com.

We would like to assure NAB that we have taken the necessary steps to correct this issue, and we will comply with the NAB procedures for providing information on the remediation of this concern within thirty (30) days. We understand that if the issue is not resolved, further action may be taken and we will do everything in our power to avoid that. We value our NAB sponsor status and will do everything necessary to maintain it."

Now write 3 email responses to Alix from AAPNC. Let them know that on January 11th, we unpublished the page they asked us to take down. Mention that we're sorry for any confusion, and if there's any other requests or pages that misinform on or misrepresent their organization please contact us with a new request.

1. Dear Alix,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to let you know that we have taken the necessary steps to address the concern raised by your organization. On January 11th, we unpublished the page that you had requested us to take down. We apologize for any confusion that may have caused and want to assure you that we take any concerns about the representation of your organization seriously.

If there are any other requests or pages that you believe may misinform or misrepresent your organization, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will take the necessary action to address any issues as soon as possible.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We value your feedback and will continue to strive for accuracy and integrity in our content.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

2. Dear Alix,

I am writing to inform you that we have taken action on the page that you had requested us to take down. On January 11th, we unpublished the page in question. We regret any confusion that this may have caused and apologize for any inconvenience.

We want to assure you that we take the representation of your organization very seriously and will do everything in our power to prevent any misinformations or misrepresentations in the future. If you have any other concerns or requests please let us know and we will take the necessary actions to address them as soon as possible.

Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We value your partnership and will continue to work towards providing accurate and relevant information to our audience.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

3. Dear Alix,

I am writing to confirm that we have taken the necessary steps to address the concern that you brought to our attention. On January 11th, we unpublished the page that you had requested us to take down. We understand the importance of accurate representation of your organization and we apologize for any confusion that may have caused.

If there are any other requests or pages that you believe may misinform or misrepresent your organization, please contact us and we will take the necessary action to address them as soon as possible. We want to assure you that we take these matters seriously and will continue to strive for accuracy and integrity in our content.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We value your partnership and look forward to continuing to provide relevant and accurate education content to healthcare professionals in long-term care.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
